end_index.description: The end index of the annotation.

type.description: The type of the annotation. Only supported type currently is `url_citation`.

url.description: The URL of the web resource.

acls.description: A list of ACLs authorized with the API key, e.g. `"api-key:endpoint:*"`, `"api-key:model:*"`.

api_key_blocked.description: Indicates whether the API key is blocked.

api_key_disabled.description: Indicates whether the API key is disabled.

create_time.description: Creation time of the API key in Unix timestamp.

modified_by.description: User ID of the user who last modified the API key.

modify_time.description: Last modification time of the API key in Unix timestamp.

name.description: The name of the API key specified by user.

team_blocked.description: Indicates whether the team that owns the API key.

team_id.description: The team ID of the team that owns the API key.

user_id.description: User ID the API key belongs to.

CandidateImage.description: A candidate image generated during Best-of-N selection.

b64_json.description: A base64-encoded string representation of the candidate image.

up_sampled_prompt.description: The upsampled prompt used to generate this candidate image.

url.description: A url to the candidate image.

ChatRequest.description: The chat request body for `/v1/chat/completions` endpoint.

deferred.description: If set to `true`, the request returns a `request_id`. You can then get the deferred response by GET `/v1/chat/deferred-completion/{request_id}`.

frequency_penalty.description: (Not supported by reasoning models) Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.description: (Unsupported) A JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

max_completion_tokens.description: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion, only applies to visible output tokens (i.e. does not apply to tokens used for reasoning or function calls). Defaults to None, meaning the model will generate as many tokens as needed up until the model's maximum context length.

max_tokens.description: \[DEPRECATED\] The maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the chat completion. Deprecated in favor of `max_completion_tokens`.

messages.description: A list of messages that make up the the chat conversation. Different models support different message types, such as image and text.

model.description: Model name for the model to use. Obtainable from <https://console.x.ai/team/default/models> or <https://docs.x.ai/docs/models>.

n.description: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message. Note that you will be charged based on the number of generated tokens across all of the choices. Keep n as 1 to minimize costs.

parallel_tool_calls.description: If set to false, the model can perform maximum one tool call.

presence_penalty.description: (Not supported by `grok-3` and reasoning models) Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

reasoning_effort.description: Constrains how hard a reasoning model thinks before responding. Not supported by `grok-4` and will result in error if used with `grok-4`. Possible values are `low` (uses fewer reasoning tokens) and `high` (uses more reasoning tokens).

oneOf.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Specify `{ "type": "json_object" }` for JSON output, or `{ "type": "json_schema", "json_schema": {...} }` for structured outputs. If `{ \"type\": \"text\" }`, the model will return a text response.
Set the parameters to be used for searched data. If not set, no data will be acquired by the model.

seed.description: If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same `seed` and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the `system_fingerprint` response parameter to monitor changes in the backend.

stop.description: (Not supported by reasoning models) Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent. Tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message.

oneOf.description: Options for streaming response. Only set this when you set `stream: true`.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

oneOf.description: Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model. `none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. required means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that tool. `none` is the default when no tools are present. `auto` is the default if tools are present.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may call in JSON-schema. Currently, only functions are supported as a tool. Use this to provide a list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for. A max of 128 functions are supported.

top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 8 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. logprobs must be set to true if this parameter is used.

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with `temperature`, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with `top_p` probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. It is generally recommended to alter this or `temperature` but not both.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

oneOf.description:
Options to control the web search. This is only included for compatibility reason. Prefer
the usage of `realtime_data_parameters` instead.

ChatResponse.description: The chat response body for `/v1/chat/completions` endpoint.

choices.description: A list of response choices from the model. The length corresponds to the `n` in request body (default to 1).

citations.description: List of all the external pages used by the model to answer.

created.description: The chat completion creation time in Unix timestamp.

id.description: A unique ID for the chat response.

model.description: Model ID used to create chat completion.

object.description: The object type, which is always `"chat.completion"`.

system_fingerprint.description: System fingerprint, used to indicate xAI system configuration changes.

oneOf.description: Token usage information.

choices.description: A list of response choices from the model. The length corresponds to the `n` in request body (default to 1).

citations.description: List of all the external pages used by the model to answer. Only populated for the last chunk.

created.description: The chat completion creation time in Unix timestamp.

id.description: A unique ID for the chat completion. Each chunk in a streaming response has the same ID.

model.description: The model ID used to create chat completion.

object.description: The object type, which is always `"chat.completion.chunk"`.

system_fingerprint.description: System fingerprint, used to indicate xAI system configuration changes.

oneOf.description: Token usage information.

finish_reason.description: Finish reason. `"stop"` means the inference has reached a model-defined or user-supplied stop sequence in `stop`. `"length"` means the inference result has reached models' maximum allowed token length or user defined value in `max_tokens`. `"end_turn"` or `null` in streaming mode when the chunk is not the last.

index.description: Index of the choice within the response choices, starting from 0.

oneOf.description: The log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

finish_reason.description: Finish reason. `"stop"` means the inference has reached a model-defined or user-supplied stop sequence in `stop`. `"length"` means the inference result has reached models' maximum allowed token length or user defined value in `max_tokens`. `"end_turn"` or `null` in streaming mode when the chunk is not the last.

oneOf.description: The log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

reasoning_content.description: The reasoning trace generated by the model.

refusal.description: The reason given by model if the model is unable to generate a response. null if model is able to generate.

role.description: The role that the message belongs to, the response from model is always `"assistant"`.

tool_calls.description: A list of tool calls asked by model for user to perform.

CodeInterpreterCall.description: The output of a code interpreter tool call.

code.description: The code of the code interpreter tool call.

id.description: The unique ID of the code interpreter tool call.

outputs.description: The outputs of the code interpreter tool call.

status.description: The status of the code interpreter tool call.

type.description: The type of the code interpreter tool call. Always `code_interpreter_call`.

oneOf.description: The output of the code interpreter tool call.

logs.description: The output of the code interpreter tool call.

oneOf.description: The error of the code interpreter tool call.

url.description: The error of the code interpreter tool call.

CompleteRequest.description: (Legacy) Anthropic compatible complete request on `/v1/complete` endpoint.

max_tokens_to_sample.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate before stopping.

oneOf.description: An object describing metadata about the request.

model.description: Model to use for completion.

prompt.description: Prompt for the model to perform completion on.

stop_sequences.description: (Not supported by reasoning models) Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

stream.description: (Unsupported) If set, partial message deltas will be sent. Tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_k.description: (Unsupported) When generating next tokens, randomly selecting the next token from the k most likely options.

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with `temperature`, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with `top_p` probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. It is generally recommended to alter this or `temperature` but not both.

CompleteResponse.description: (Legacy) Anthropic compatible complete response on `/v1/complete` endpoint.

completion.description: The completion content up to and excluding stop sequences.

id.description: ID of the completion response.

model.description: The model that handled the request.

stop_reason.description: The reason to stop completion. `"stop_sequence"` means the inference has reached a model-defined or user-supplied stop sequence in `stop`. `"length"` means the inference result has reached models' maximum allowed token length or user defined value in `max_tokens`. `"end_turn"` or `null` in streaming mode when the chunk is not the last.

type.description: Completion response object type. This is always `"completion"`.

accepted_prediction_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the prediction that appeared in the completion.

audio_tokens.description: Audio input tokens generated by the model.

reasoning_tokens.description: Tokens generated by the model for reasoning.

rejected_prediction_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the prediction that did not appear in the completion.

oneOf.description: Text prompt.
An array of content parts of different types, such as image, text or text file.
File reference for file attachments (OpenAI-compatible nesting).
A public URL of image prompt, only available for vision models.

text_file.description: File path to a text file to be used as prompt.

type.description: The type of the content part.

CustomToolCall.description: The output of a custom tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The status of the custom tool call.

input.description: The unique ID of the custom tool call,

name.description: An identifier used to map this custom tool call to a tool call output.

status.description: Status of the item. One of `completed`, `in_progress` or `incomplete`.

type.description: The input for the custom tool call generated by the model.

attempts.description: Number of attempts made to the model.

chunks.description: The individual chunks returned from the pipeline of samplers.

engine_request.description: JSON-serialized request sent to the inference engine.

prompt.description: The prompt sent to the model in text form.

request.description: The request received from the user.

responses.description: The response(s) received from the model.

sampler_checkpoint_mount.description: The underlying checkpoint mount path for the sampler that served this request.

sampler_tag.description: The tag of the actual engines sitting behind the GTP address. Eg "grok-4-code-eapi-lap4-unified-sblbm-0"

DeleteStoredCompletionResponse.description: Response to delete a stored completion.

deleted.description: Whether the response was successfully deleted.

id.description: The response_id to be deleted.

object.description: The deleted object type, which is always `response`.

DocumentsSource.description: DocumentsSource defines the source of documents to search over.

collection_ids.description: The collection IDs to search in.

image.description: Input image to perform edit on.

model.description: Model to be used.

n.description: Number of image edits to be generated.

oneOf.description: Quality of the output image. Can be `low`, `medium`, or `high`. Currently a no-op, reserved for future use.

Resolution of the generated image. Defaults to `1k`.
Aspect ratio is automatically detected from the input image.
Only supported by grok-imagine models.

response_format.description: Response format to return the image in. Can be `url` or `b64_json`. If `b64_json` is specified, the image will be returned as a base64-encoded string instead of a url to the generated image file.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

EditVideoRequest.description: Request for editing video for `/v1/videos/edits` endpoint

model.description: Model to be used.

oneOf.description: Optional output destination for generated video.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user.

video.description: Input video to perform edit on.

index.description: Index of the embedding object in the data list.

object.description: The object type, which is always `"embedding"`.

oneOf.description: Embedding in base64 string.
Embedding as an array of floats.
A strings to be embedded. For best performance, prepend "query: " in front of query content and prepend "passage: " in front of passage/text

String.description: A strings to be embedded. For best performance, prepend "query: " in front of query content and prepend "passage: " in front of passage/text

oneOf.description: An array of strings to be embedded

StringArray.description: An array of strings to be embedded

oneOf.description: A token in integer to be embedded

Ints.description: A token in integer to be embedded

oneOf.description: An array of tokens in integers to be embedded

IntsArray.description: An array of tokens in integers to be embedded

aliases.description: Alias ID(s) of the model that user can use in a request's model field.

created.description: Model creation time in Unix timestamp.

fingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the xAI system configuration hosting the model.

id.description: Model ID. Obtainable from <https://console.x.ai/team/default/models> or <https://docs.x.ai/docs/models>.

input_modalities.description: The input modalities supported by the model.

output_modalities.description: The output modalities supported by the model.

prompt_image_token_price.description: Price of the prompt image token in USD cents per million token.

prompt_text_token_price.description: Price of the prompt text token in USD cents per million token.

dimensions.description: The number of dimensions the resulting output embeddings should have.

encoding_format.description: The format to return the embeddings in. Can be either `float` or `base64`.

input.description: Input text to embed, encoded as a string or list of tokens. To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass a list of strings or list of token lists. The total tokens in the input must not exceed the context window for the model and cannot be an empty string. If the input is a list, the maximum length of the list is 128.

model.description: ID of the model to use.

preview.description: Flag to use the new format of the API.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

model.description: Model ID used to create embedding.

object.description: The object type of `data` field, which is always `"list"`.

oneOf.description: Token usage information.

file_id.description: The file ID from the Files API.

FileSearchCall.description: The output of a web search tool call.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

results.description: The results of the file search tool call.

status.description: The status of the file search tool call.

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

file_id.description: The file ID of the file search result.

filename.description: The filename of the file search result.

score.description: The score of the file search result.

text.description: The text of the file search result.

FunctionDefinition.description: Definition of the tool call made available to the model.

description.description: A description of the function to indicate to the model when to call it.

name.description:
The name of the function. If the model calls the function, this name is used in the
response.

parameters.description:
A JSON schema describing the function parameters. The model _should_ follow the schema,
however, this is not enforced at the moment.

strict.description: Not supported. Only maintained for compatibility reasons.

FunctionToolCall.description: A tool call to run a function.

arguments.description: The arguments to pass to the function, as a JSON string.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call.

status.description: Status of the item. One of `completed`, `in_progress` or `incomplete`.

type.description:
The type of the function tool call, which can be `"function_call"` for client-side tool calls,
and `"web_search_call"` or `"x_search_call"` or `"code_interpreter_call"` or `"mcp_call"` for server-side tool calls.

FunctionToolCallOutput.description: The output of a function tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

output.description: The output of the function tool call, as a JSON string.

type.description: The type of the function tool call, which is always `function_call_output`.

oneOf.description:
Aspect ratio of the generated image. Can be `1:1`, `3:4`, `4:3`, `9:16`, or `16:9`. Defaults to `1:1`.
Only supported by grok-imagine models.

model.description: Model to be used.

n.description: Number of images to be generated

oneOf.description: Quality of the output image. Can be `low`, `medium`, or `high`. Currently a no-op, reserved for future use.

Resolution of the generated image. Defaults to `1k`.
Only supported by grok-imagine models.
Currently, only `1k` is supported. Support for `2k` will be available shortly.

response_format.description: Response format to return the image in. Can be url or b64_json. If b64_json is specified, the image will be returned as a base64-encoded string instead of a url to the generated image file.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

GenerateVideoRequest.description: Request to generate video for `/v1/videos/generations` endpoint

oneOf.description: Aspect ratio of the generated video.

duration.description: Video duration in seconds. Range: [1, 15]. Default: 8.

oneOf.description:
Optional input image for image-to-video generation.
If provided, generates video with this image as the first frame.

model.description: Model to be used.

oneOf.description: Optional output destination for generated video.
Resolution of the generated video.

The size of the generated video. DEPRECATED: Use aspect_ratio and resolution instead.
Defaults to "848x480" (16:9) if not specified.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user.

b64_json.description: A base64-encoded string representation of the generated image in `jpeg` encoding, if `b64_json` is specified as `response_format` in the request.

revised_prompt.description: The revised prompt generated by a chat model from the original prompt. This prompt is used in the final image generation.

url.description: A url to the generated image, if `response_format` is not specified or with `url` in the request.

GeneratedImageDebugOutput.description:
Debug output for image generation. Only available to trusted testers.
Contains information about Best-of-N (BoN) candidate images and grading scores.

best_local_idx.description: The index of the best image selected from the candidates.

candidate_images.description: List of candidate images generated during Best-of-N selection.

grading_scores.description: Grading scores for each candidate image.

raw_grading.description: The raw grading output from the grader model.

data.description: A list of generated image objects.

duration.description: Duration of the generated video in seconds.

respect_moderation.description:
Whether the video generated by the model respects moderation rules.
The field will be true if the video respects moderation rules. Otherwise
the field will be false and the video url field will be empty.

url.description: A url to the generated video.

GetDeferredVideoRequest.description: Request to get deferred video result with a request ID.

request_id.description: The request ID returned by a previous video generation request.

GetDeferredVideoResponse.description: Response for getting deferred video result.

oneOf.description: The generated video response. Only present if status is "done".

status.description: Status of the deferred request: "pending" or "done".

allOf.description: Use a reranker model to perform the reranking.

oneOf.description: Use a reranker model to perform the reranking.

allOf.description: Use RRF to perform the reranking.

oneOf.description: Use RRF to perform the reranking.

HybridRetrieval.description: Document search using a combination of keyword and semantic search.

oneOf.description: Which reranker to use to limit results to the desired value.

search_multiplier.description:
Additional multiplier to requested search limit.
Valid range is [1, 100]. Defaults to 1 when unset.

ImageAspectRatio.description:
Aspect ratio for image generation.
Only supported by grok-imagine models.

ImageGenerationModel.description: Details of an image generation model

aliases.description: Alias ID(s) of the model that user can use in a request's model field.

created.description: Model creation time in Unix timestamp.

fingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the xAI system configuration hosting the model.

id.description: Model ID.

image_price.description: Price of a single image in USD cents.

input_modalities.description: The input modalities supported by the model.

object.description: The object type, which is always `"model"`.

output_modalities.description: The output modalities supported by the model.

ImageQuality.description:
Request to generate image for `/v1/image/generations` endpoint
Quality level for image generation.
Note: Currently a no-op, reserved for future use.

ImageResolution.description:
Resolution for image generation.
Only supported by grok-imagine models.

ImageUrl.description: Image URL object of Image prompt

IncompleteDetails.description: Details about why a response is incomplete.

cached_tokens.description: Token cached by xAI from previous requests and reused for this request.

KeywordRetrieval.description: Document search using keyword matching (sparse embeddings).

oneOf.description: Optional, but always used when doing search across multiple collections.

aliases.description: Alias ID(s) of the model that user can use in a request's model field.

cached_prompt_text_token_price.description: Price of a prompt text token (in USD cents per 100 million tokens) that was cached previously.

completion_text_token_price.description: Price of the completion text token in USD cents per 100 million token.

created.description: Creation time of the model in Unix timestamp.

fingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the xAI system configuration hosting the model.

id.description: Model ID. Obtainable from <https://console.x.ai/team/default/models> or <https://docs.x.ai/docs/models>.

input_modalities.description: The input modalities supported by the model, e.g. `"text"`, `"image"`.

object.description: The object type, which is always `"model"`.

output_modalities.description: The output modalities supported by the model, e.g. `"text"`, `"image"`.

prompt_image_token_price.description: Price of the prompt image token in USD cents per 100 million token.

prompt_text_token_price.description: Price of the prompt text token in USD cents per 100 million token.

search_price.description: Price of the search in USD cents per 100 million searches.

models.description: Array of available image generation models.

data.description: A list of models with with minimalized information.

object.description: The object type of `data` field, which is always `"list"`.

content.description: An array the log probabilities of each output token returned.

McpCall.description: The output of a MCP tool call.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments passed to the tool.

error.description: The error message of the MCP tool call.

id.description: The unique ID of the MCP tool call.

name.description: The name of the tool that was run.

output.description: The output of the MCP tool call.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server running the tool.

status.description: The status of the MCP tool call.

type.description: The type of the MCP tool call. Always `mcp_call`.

oneOf.description: System message, usually instructions for the model to respond in a certain way.

name.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

oneOf.description: User message, typically request from user for the model to answer.

name.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

oneOf.description: Assistant role message, previous chat messages from the model.
Assistant prompt content.

name.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

tool_calls.description: An array of tool calls available to the model on your machine.

oneOf.description: Tool call role message, used to return function call result to the model.

content.description: Content of the tool call result.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call received from assistant message response.

oneOf.description: Function call role message. Deprecated in favor of `{"role": "tool"}`.

content.description: Content of the tool call result.

name.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

role.description: The role that the message belongs to, `"system"` for system prompt, `"user"` for user prompt, and `"assistant"` for response from the model.

oneOf.description: Text prompt.
An array of message content parts.
Text prompt message content part.
Image prompt message content part.
Tool call message content part. Received from model.

id.description: ID of the tool call.

oneOf.description: Tool call result.

content.description: Result content of the tool call.

is_error.description: Whether the tool call returns an error.

tool_use_id.description: ID of the tool call given by the model.

oneOf.description: (Redacted) Thinking of the model.

data.description: Encrypted data of the redacted thinking.

oneOf.description: Thinking of the model.

media_type.description: Media type of the image source. Available options: `image/jpeg`, `image/png`, `image/webp`.

user_id.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate before stopping. The model may stop before the max_tokens when it reaches the stop sequence.

oneOf.description: An object describing metadata about the request.

model.description: Model name for the model to use.

stop_sequences.description: (Not supported by reasoning models) Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent. Tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message.

oneOf.description: System prompt message for the model, defining how the model should behave to user messages.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. It may not work well with reasoning models.

oneOf.description: Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model. `"none"` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. `"auto"` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. `"any"` means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "tool", "function": {"name": "get_weather"}}` forces the model to call that tool. `"none"` is the default when no tools are provided. `"auto"` is the default if tools are provided.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may call in JSON-schema. Currently, only functions are supported as a tool. Use this to provide a list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for. A max of 128 functions are supported.

top_k.description: (Unsupported) When generating next tokens, randomly selecting the next token from the k most likely options.

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with `temperature`, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with `top_p` probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. It is generally recommended to alter this or `temperature` but not both.

id.description: Unique object identifier.

model.description: Model name that handled the request.

role.description: Role of the generated message. Always `"assistant"`

stop_reason.description: Reason to stop. `"stop_sequence"` means the inference has reached a model-defined or user-supplied stop sequence in `stop`. `"max_tokens"` means the inference result has reached models' maximum allowed token length or user defined value in `max_tokens`. `"end_turn"` or `null` in streaming mode when the chunk is not the last. `"tool_use"` means the model has called a tool and is waiting for the tool response.

stop_sequence.description: Custom stop sequence used to stop the generation.

type.description: Object type. This is always `"message"` for message types.

oneOf.description: Text response from the model.
Thinking response for the model
Redacted thinking response for the model
Request by the model to invoke a tool call.

id.description: Tool call ID.

input.description: Input to the tool call follwing the `input_schema`.

name.description: Name of the tool call to be used.

oneOf.description: Allows the model to automatically decide whether to call the tool
Forces the model to use at least one tool, without specifying the tool.
Forces the model to use the named tool

name.description: Name of the tool to use.

properties.description: JSON-object of the tool input schema.

required.description: Required properties of the tool input schema, if any.

type.description: Type of the schema. This is always `"object"`.

input_schema.description: Input schema allowed by the tool.

cache_creation_input_tokens.description: (Unsupported) Number of tokens written to the cache when creating a new entry.

cache_read_input_tokens.description: Number of tokens retrieved from the cache for this request.

Model.description: Same as `LanguageModel` but fully compliant with the OpenAI API.

created.description: Model creation time in Unix timestamp.

id.description: Model ID. Obtainable from <https://console.x.ai/team/default/models> or <https://docs.x.ai/docs/models>.

object.description: The object type, which is always `"model"`.

ModelInput.description: Content of the input passed to a `/v1/response` request.

oneOf.description: Text input.
A list of input items to the model. Can be of different types.
Text input.
A list of input items to the model. Can include text and images.
Text input.
Image input. Note: Storing and fetching images is not fully supported at the moment.

image_url.description: A public URL of image prompt, only available for vision models.

oneOf.description: File input.

file_data.description:
Inline file bytes (base64 encoded).

When set, the file content is provided directly in the request and does NOT need
to be uploaded to the Files API first.

Exactly one of `file_id` or `file_data` should be set.

file_id.description:
The file ID from the Files API.

Set this to reference a previously-uploaded file.

filename.description:
Filename for inline uploads.

Required when `file_data` is set.

mime_type.description: Optional MIME type for inline uploads (e.g. "application/pdf").

oneOf.description: Message input to the model.

name.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse. Only supported for `user` messages.

role.description: The role of the message. Possible values are `user`, `assistant`, `system` and `developer`.

type.description: The type of the message, which is always `message`.

oneOf.description: Previous responses of the model and tool call outputs.

background.description: (Unsupported) Whether to process the response asynchronously in the background.

include.description: What additional output data to include in the response. Currently the only supported value is `reasoning.encrypted_content` which returns an encrypted version of the reasoning tokens.

input.description: The input passed to the model. Can be text, image or file.

instructions.description: An alternate way to specify the system prompt. Note that this cannot be used alongside `previous_response_id`, where the system prompt of the previous message will be used.

logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

max_output_tokens.description: Max number of tokens that can be generated in a response. This includes both output and reasoning tokens.

metadata.description: Not supported. Only maintained for compatibility reasons.

model.description: Model name for the model to use. Obtainable from <https://console.x.ai/team/default/models> or <https://docs.x.ai/docs/models>.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run parallel tool calls.

previous_response_id.description: The ID of the previous response from the model.

prompt_cache_key.description: Plumbed to x-grok-conv-id for Open Responses compatibility, used for routing.

oneOf.description: Reasoning configuration. Only for reasoning models.
Set the parameters to be used for searched data. Takes precedence over `web_search_preview` tool if specified in the tools.

service_tier.description: Not supported. Only maintained for compatibility reasons.

store.description: Whether to store the input message(s) and model response for later retrieval.

stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent. Tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

oneOf.description: Settings for customizing a text response from the model.

Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model. `none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. required means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that tool. `none` is the default when no tools are present. `auto` is the default if tools are present.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may call in JSON-schema. Currently, only functions and web search are supported as tools. A max of 128 tools are supported.`web_search_preview` tool, if specified, will be overridden by `search_parameters`.

top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 8 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. logprobs must be set to true if this parameter is used.

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with `temperature`, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with `top_p` probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. It is generally recommended to alter this or `temperature` but not both.

truncation.description: Not supported. Only maintained for compatibility reasons.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

background.description:
OpenResponses compatibility fields.
Not used at the moment. Just for OpenResponses compatibility.
Whether to process the response asynchronously in the background.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for the response completion time. Only set when the response is completed.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for the response creation time.

error.description: An error object returned when the model fails to generate a response.

frequency_penalty.description: (NOT SUPPORTED in Responses API) Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

id.description: Unique ID of the response.

oneOf.description: Details about why the response is incomplete.

instructions.description: A system (or developer) message inserted into the model's context.

max_output_tokens.description: Max number of tokens that can be generated in a response. This includes both output and reasoning tokens.

max_tool_calls.description: The maximum number of tool calls allowed for this response.

model.description: Model name used to generate the response.

object.description: The object type of this resource. Always set to `response`.

output.description: The response generated by the model.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run parallel tool calls.

presence_penalty.description: (NOT SUPPORTED in Responses API) Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

previous_response_id.description: The ID of the previous response from the model.

prompt_cache_key.description: The cache key used for the prompt for routing to the correct engine.

oneOf.description: Reasoning configuration. Only for reasoning models.

safety_identifier.description: A stable identifier used to help detect users of your application that may be violating xAI's usage policies.

service_tier.description: Specifies the processing tier used for serving the request.

status.description: Status of the response. One of `completed`, `in_progress` or `incomplete`.

store.description: Whether to store the input message(s) and model response for later retrieval.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

text.description: Settings for customizing a text response from the model.

tool_choice.description: Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model. auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. required means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that tool. `none` is the default when no tools are present. `auto` is the default if tools are present.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may call in JSON-schema. Currently, only functions and web search are supported as tools. A max of 128 tools are supported.

top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 8 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position.

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with `temperature`, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with `top_p` probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. It is generally recommended to alter this or `temperature` but not both.

truncation.description: The truncation strategy to use for the model response.

oneOf.description: Token usage information.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

oneOf.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Specify `{ "type": "json_object" }` for JSON output, or `{ "type": "json_schema", "json_schema": {...} }` for structured outputs. If `{ \"type\": \"text\" }`, the model will return a text response.

ModelResponseFormat.description: Response format parameter for structured outputs.

oneOf.description: Specify text response format, always `"text"`.
Specify json_object response format, always `json_object`. Used for backward compatibility. Prefer to use `"json_schema"` instead of this.
Specify json_schema response format with a given schema. Type is always `"json_schema"`.

schema.description: A json schema representing the desired response schema.

ModelTool.description: Definition of one tool that the model can call.

allOf.description: A function that the model can call.

oneOf.description: A function that the model can call.

allowed_domains.description:
List of website domains to allow in the search results. This parameter act as a whitelist
where only those websites can be selected. A maximum of 5 websites can be selected.

Note: This parameter cannot be set with `excluded_domains`.

enable_image_understanding.description: Enable image understanding during web search.

excluded_domains.description:
List of website domains to exclude from the search results without protocol specification or
subdomains. A maximum of 5 websites can be excluded.

Note: This parameter cannot be set with `allowed_domains`

external_web_access.description:
Control whether the web search tool fetches live content or uses only cached content.
For OpenAI API compatibility ONLY. Request will be rejected if this field is set.

oneOf.description: Filters to apply to the search results. Compatible with OpenAI's API.

search_context_size.description:
High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the
search. Available values are `low`, `medium`, or `high`.
For OpenAI API compatibility ONLY. Request will be rejected if this field is set.

oneOf.description:
The user location to use for the search.
For OpenAI API compatibility ONLY. Request will be rejected if this field is set.
Search the web.
Search X.

allowed_x_handles.description:
List of X Handles of the users from whom to consider the posts.

Note: This parameter cannot be set with `excluded_x_handles`.

enable_image_understanding.description: Enable image understanding during X search.

enable_video_understanding.description: Enable video understanding during X search.

excluded_x_handles.description:
List of X Handles of the users from whom to exclude the posts.

Note: This parameter cannot be set with `allowed_x_handles`.

from_date.description:
Date from which to consider the results in ISO-8601 YYYY-MM-DD. See
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>.

to_date.description:
Date up to which to consider the results in ISO-8601 YYYY-MM-DD. See
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>.

oneOf.description: Search the knowledge bases.

filters.description:
A filter to apply.
For OpenAI API compatibility ONLY. Request will be rejected if this field is set.

ranking_options.description:
Ranking options for search.
For OpenAI API compatibility ONLY. Request will be rejected if this field is set.

vector_store_ids.description: List of vector store IDs to search within.

oneOf.description: Execute code.

container.description:
The code interpreter container. Can be a container ID or an object that specifies
uploaded file IDs to make available to your code.
For OpenAI API compatibility ONLY. Request will be rejected if this field is set.

oneOf.description: A remote MCP server to use.

ModelToolChoice.description: Parameter to control how model chooses the tools.

oneOf.description: Controls tool access by the model. `"none"` makes model ignore tools, `"auto"` let the model automatically decide whether to call a tool, `"required"` forces model to pick a tool to call.

name.description: Name of the function to use.

type.description: Type is always `"function"`.

cost_in_nano_usd.description: Cost in nano US dollars for this request.

cost_in_usd_ticks.description:
Accurate cost of this request in USD ticks, where "tick" is defined as follows:
TICKS_IN_USD_CENT: i64 = 100_000_000
which means there is 10'000'000'000 ticks in one *dollar*.

num_server_side_tools_used.description: Number of server side tools used.

num_sources_used.description: Number of sources used (for live search).

oneOf.description: Details about the server side tool usage.

ModerationLevel.description:
Moderation level for image and video generation.
Controls the strictness of content moderation for generated content.

OutputMessage.description: An output message from the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the output message.

role.description: The role of the output message, which can be `assistant` or `tool`.

status.description: Status of the item. One of `completed`, `in_progress` or `incomplete`.

type.description: The type of the output message, which is always `message`.

oneOf.description: Text output.

logprobs.description: The log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

text.description: The text output from the model.

oneOf.description: Refusal.

reasoning_tokens.description: Tokens generated by the model for reasoning.

cached_tokens.description: Token cached by xAI from previous requests and reused for this request.

text_tokens.description: Total text prompt token used (cached + non-cached text tokens).

RankingMetric.description: Deprecated: Metric now comes from collection creation.

Reasoning.description: The reasoning done by the model.

encrypted_content.description: The enrypted reasoning. Returned when `reasoning.encrypted_content` is passed in `include`.

id.description: The unique ID of the reasoning content.

status.description: Status of the item. One of `completed`, `in_progress` or `incomplete`.

type.description: The type of the object, which is always `reasoning`.

effort.description: Constrains how hard a reasoning model thinks before responding. Possible values are `low` (uses fewer reasoning tokens), `medium` and `high` (uses more reasoning tokens).

summary.description: A summary of the model's reasoning process. Possible values are `auto`, `concise` and `detailed`. Only included for compatibility. The model shall always return `detailed`.

type.description: The type of the object, which is always `reasoning_text`.

ReciprocalRankFusion.description: Configuration for reciprocal rank fusion (RRF) reranking.

embedding_weight.description: Weight for embedding (dense) search results. Should be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.5.

k.description: The RRF constant k used in the reciprocal rank fusion formula. Defaults to 60.

text_weight.description: Weight for keyword (sparse) search results. Should be between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.5.

instructions.description: Instructions for the reranking model. Defaults to generic reranking instructions.

model.description: The model to use for reranking. Defaults to standard reranker model.

ResponseFormat.description: Response format parameter for structured outputs.

oneOf.description: Specify text response format, always `"text"`.
Specify json_object response format, always `json_object`. Used for backward compatibility. Prefer to use `"json_schema"` instead of this.
Specify json_schema response format with a given schema. Type is always `"json_schema"`.

json_schema.description: A json schema representing the desired response schema. Includes the schema as a `"schema"` field.

RetrievalMode.description: Retrieval mode configuration for document search.

allOf.description: Hybrid search combining keyword and semantic search.

oneOf.description: Hybrid search combining keyword and semantic search.
Semantic search using dense embeddings.
Keyword search using sparse embeddings.

finish_reason.description: Finish reason. `"stop"` means the inference has reached a model-defined or user-supplied stop sequence in `stop`. `"length"` means the inference result has reached models' maximum allowed token length or user defined value in `max_tokens`. `"end_turn"` or `null` in streaming mode when the chunk is not the last.

oneOf.description: Text prompt.
An array of strings, a token list, or an array of token lists.

best_of.description: (Unsupported) Generates multiple completions internally and returns the top-scoring one. Not functional yet.

echo.description: Option to include the original prompt in the response along with the generated completion.

frequency_penalty.description: (Unsupported) Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.description: (Unsupported) Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. You can use this tokenizer tool to convert text to token IDs. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

logprobs.description: Include the log probabilities on the `logprobs` most likely output tokens, as well the chosen tokens. For example, if `logprobs` is 5, the API will return a list of the 5 most likely tokens. The API will always return the logprob of the sampled token, so there may be up to `logprobs+1` elements in the response.

max_tokens.description: Limits the number of tokens that can be produced in the output. Ensure the sum of prompt tokens and `max_tokens` does not exceed the model's context limit.

model.description: Specifies the model to be used for the request.

n.description: Determines how many completion sequences to produce for each prompt. Be cautious with its use due to high token consumption; adjust `max_tokens` and stop sequences accordingly.

presence_penalty.description: (Not supported by `grok-3` and reasoning models) Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

prompt.description: Input for generating completions, which can be a string, list of strings, token list, or list of token lists. `<|endoftext|>` is used as a document separator, implying a new context start if omitted.

seed.description: If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same seed and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the system_fingerprint response parameter to monitor changes in the backend.

stop.description: (Not supported by reasoning models) Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

stream.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. If set, tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message.

oneOf.description: Options for streaming response. Only set this when you set `stream: true`.

suffix.description: (Unsupported) Optional string to append after the generated text.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or `top_p` but not both.

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with `top_p` probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help xAI to monitor and detect abuse.

choices.description: A list of response choices from the model. The length corresponds to the `n` in request body (default to 1).

created.description: The chat completion creation time in Unix timestamp.

id.description: ID of the request.

model.description: Model to be used.

object.description: Object type of the response. This is always `"text_completion"`.

system_fingerprint.description: System fingerprint, used to indicate xAI system configuration changes.

oneOf.description: Token usage information.

SearchMatch.description: SearchMatch defines a single match from a search request.

fields.description: Metadata fields belonging to the document of this chunk.

from_date.description:
Date from which to consider the results in ISO-8601 YYYY-MM-DD. See
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>.

max_search_results.description: Maximum number of search results to use.

mode.description:
Choose the mode to query realtime data:
* `off`: no search performed and no external will be considered.
* `on` (default): the model will search in every sources for relevant data.
* `auto`: the model choose whether to search data or not and where to search the data.

return_citations.description: Whether to return citations in the response or not.

sources.description: List of sources to search in. If no sources specified, the model will look over the web and X by default.

to_date.description:
Date up to which to consider the results in ISO-8601 YYYY-MM-DD. See
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>.

SearchRequest.description: SearchRequest defines the request to search for documents.

filter.description:
Optional metadata filter string to apply to search results.
Uses AIP-160 filter syntax for querying document metadata.
Supports comparison operators: `=`, `!=`, `>`, `>=`, `<`, `<=`
Supports logical operators: `AND`, `OR`
Supports range syntax: `field:10..20` (inclusive)
Examples: `author = "John"` or `year > 2020 AND category = "finance"`

instructions.description: User-defined instructions to be included in the search query. Defaults to generic search instructions.

limit.description:
The number of chunks to return.
Will always return the top matching chunks.
Optional, defaults to 10.

query.description:
The query to search for which will be embedded using the
same embedding model as the one used for the source to query.

oneOf.description: Deprecated: Metric now comes from collection creation.
How to perform the document search. Defaults to hybrid retrieval.

SearchResponse.description: SearchResponse defines the response to a search request.

excluded_x_handles.description:
List of X handles to exclude from the search results. X posts returned will not include
any posts authored by these handles.

included_x_handles.description:
NOTE: `included_x_handles` and `x_handles` are the same parameter.
`included_x_handles` is the new name but we keep both for backward compatibility.

X Handles of the users from whom to consider the posts. Only available if mode is `auto`, `on` or `x`.

post_favorite_count.description: The minimum favorite count of the X posts to consider.

post_view_count.description: The minimum view count of the X posts to consider.

x_handles.description:
DEPRECATED in favor of `included_x_handles`. Use `included_x_handles` instead.
X Handles of the users from whom to consider the posts. Only available if mode is `auto`, `on` or `x`.

allowed_websites.description:
List of website to allow in the search results. This parameter act as a whitelist
where only those websites can be selected. A maximum of 5 websites can be selected.

Note 1: If no relevant information is found on those websites, the number of results
returned might be smaller than `max_search_results`.

Note 2: This parameter cannot be set with `excluded_websites`.

country.description:
ISO alpha-2 code of the country. If the country is set, only data coming from this country
will be considered. See <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2>.

excluded_websites.description:
List of website to exclude from the search results without protocol specification or
subdomains. A maximum of 5 websites can be excluded.

Note 2: This parameter cannot be set with `allowed_websites`

safe_search.description: If set to true, mature content won't be considered during the search. Default to `true`.

country.description:
ISO alpha-2 code of the country. If the country is set, only data coming from this country
will be considered. See <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2>.

excluded_websites.description:
List of website to exclude from the search results without protocol specification or
subdomains. A maximum of 5 websites can be excluded.

safe_search.description: If set to true, mature content won't be considered during the search. Default to `true`.

SemanticRetrieval.description: Document search using semantic similarity (dense embeddings).

oneOf.description: Optional, but always used when doing search across multiple collections.

request_id.description: A unique request ID for the chat response.

StartDeferredResponse.description: Response for starting a deferred operation.

request_id.description: A unique request ID to poll for the result.

StreamOptions.description: Options available when using streaming response.

include_usage.description: Set an additional chunk to be streamed before the `data: [DONE]` message. The other chunks will return `null` in `usage` field.

text.description: Summary of the reasoning done by the model.

type.description: The type of the object, which is always `summary_text`.

oneOf.description: Text content of system prompt.
An array of system prompt parts.

type.description: Type of the object. This is always `"text"`.

bytes.description: The ASCII encoding of the output character.

logprob.description: The log probability of returning this token.

top_logprobs.description: An array of the most likely tokens to return at this token position.

model.description: The model to tokenize with.

text.description: The text content to be tokenized.

token_bytes.description: The bytes that constituted the token.

token_id.description: The integer representation of the token for the model.

Tool.description: Definition of one tool that the model can call.

function.description: Definition of tool call available to the model.
Function to call for the tool call.

id.description: A unique ID of the tool call generated by xAI. After performing tool call's function, user provides this ID with tool call's result in the subsequent request to xAI. xAI can then match the tool call result sent with tool call request.

type.description: Type of tool call, should be `"function"` or `"web_search_call"` or `"x_search_call"` or `"code_interpreter_call"` or `"mcp_call"`

ToolChoice.description: Parameter to control how model chooses the tools.

oneOf.description: Controls tool access by the model. `"none"` makes model ignore tools, `"auto"` let the model automatically decide whether to call a tool, `"required"` forces model to pick a tool to call.
Name of the function to use.

type.description: Type is always `"function"`.

bytes.description: The ASCII encoding of the output character.

logprob.description: The log probability of returning this token.

completion_tokens_details.description: Breakdown of completion token usage of different types.

cost_in_usd_ticks.description:
Accurate cost of this request in USD ticks, where "tick" is defined as follows:
TICKS_IN_USD_CENT: i64 = 100_000_000
which means there is 10'000'000'000 ticks in one *dollar*.

num_sources_used.description: Number of individual live search source used.

prompt_tokens_details.description: Breakdown of prompt token usage of different types.

total_tokens.description: Total token used, the sum of prompt token and completion token amount.

VideoDebugOutput.description: Debug output for video generation. Only available to trusted testers.

upsampled_prompt.description: The upsampled prompt used to generate the video.

upload_url.description: Signed URL to upload the generated video via HTTP PUT.

model.description: The model used to generate the video.

VideoSize.description:
Supported video sizes for video generation.
Defaults to 848x480 (16:9) if not specified.

VideoUrl.description: Video URL for video editing input

url.description: URL of the video (public URL or base64-encoded data URL).

oneOf.description: Action type "search" - Performs a web search query.

sources.description: The sources used in the search.

oneOf.description: Action type "open_page" - Opens a specific URL from search results.

url.description: The URL of the page to open.

oneOf.description: Action type "find": Searches for a pattern within a loaded page.

pattern.description: The pattern or text to search for within the page.

source.description: The source of the page to search in.

WebSearchCall.description: The output of a web search tool call.

action.description:
An object describing the specific action taken in this web search call.
Includes details on how the model used the web (search, open_page, find).

id.description: The unique ID of the web search tool call.

status.description: The status of the web search tool call.

type.description: The type of the web search tool call. Always `web_search_call`.

allowed_domains.description:
List of website domains (without protocol specification or subdomains)
to restrict search results to (e.g., ["example.com"]). A maximum of 5 websites can be allowed.
Use this as a whitelist to limit results to only these specific sites; no other websites will
be considered. If no relevant information is found on these websites, the number of results
returned might be smaller than `max_search_results` set in `SearchParameters`. Note: This
parameter cannot be set together with `excluded_domains`.

excluded_domains.description:
List of website domains (without protocol specification or subdomains) to exclude from search results (e.g., ["example.com"]).
Use this to prevent results from unwanted sites. A maximum of 5 websites can be excluded.
This parameter cannot be set together with `allowed_domains`.

search_context_size.description: This field included for compatibility reason with OpenAI's API. It is mapped to `max_search`.

type.description: The type of source.

country.description: Two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, like US, GB, etc.

timezone.description: Timezone of the user's location, IANA timezone like America/Chicago, Europe/London, etc.

type.description: Type is always `"approximate"`.

data.revised_prompt: A high-resolution photograph of a cat perched on a branch in a lush, green tree during the daytime. The cat, possibly a tabby with distinctive fur patterns, is the central focus of the image, looking curiously forward with its fur slightly ruffled. The background features a serene park setting with other trees and a clear sky, ensuring no distractions from the main subject. The lighting is soft and natural, enhancing the realistic and calm atmosphere of the scene.<|separator|><|eos|>

1. A high-resolution photograph of a gray tabby cat perched on a branch of a lush, green tree in a suburban backyard during the day. The cat is facing forward, with its fur slightly ruffled by a gentle breeze. The background features other trees and a distant house, all slightly out of focus to emphasize the cat. The lighting is natural, with sunlight filtering through the leaves, creating a serene and realistic setting. The composition focuses primarily on the cat, ensuring it remains the central subject of the image.<|separator|><|eos|>

summary.text:
First, the user asked: "What is 101*3?"

This is a simple multiplication: 101 multiplied by 3.

Calculating: 100 * 3 = 300, and 1 * 3 = 3, so 300 + 3 = 303.

I should respond helpfully and directly, as per my system prompt: "You are a helpful assistant that can answer questions and help with tasks."

Keep the response concise and accurate. No need for extra fluff unless it adds value.

Final answer: 303.
